item.title: Larry Finger made Linux wireless work and brought others along to learn
item.description: Remembering Finger, 84, who learned as he went and left his mark on many.
item.author: (Kevin Purdy - 6/24/2024, 12:21 PM)

item.title: Why Google Sheets ported its calculation worker from JavaScript to WasmGC  |  web.dev
item.description: Calculations in Google Sheets were initially done on the server, then on the client in JavaScript, and now on the client in WebAssembly Garbage Collection. This case study explains how and why.
item.author: (Michael Thomas)

item.title: Writing a remove_all_pointers type trait, part 1 - The Old New Thing
item.description: Delaying the expansion to avoid infinite recursion.
item.author: (Raymond Chen)

item.title: On Claude 3.5 Sonnet
item.description: There is a new clear best (non-tiny) LLM. If you want to converse with an LLM, the correct answer is Claude Sonnet 3.5. It is available for free on Claude.ai and the Claude iOS app, or you can subscribe for higher rate limits. The API cost is $3 per million input tokens and $15 per million output tokens.
item.author: (Zvi Mowshowitz)

item.title: South Korean telecom company attacks torrent users with malware — over 600,000 customers report missing files, strange folders, and disabled PCs
item.description: ISP sends malware to hundreds of thousands of customers to stop them from using a file-sharing service.
item.author: (Jowi MoralesSocial Links NavigationFreelance News Writer)

item.title: ASP.NET Core Basics: Documenting APIs
item.description: Well-documented APIs are essential for the success of a web project. Check out this post for some important resources for documenting APIs in ASP.NET Core.

item.title: Ecma International approves ECMAScript 2024: What’s new?
item.description: On 26 June 2024, the 127th Ecma General Assembly approved the ECMAScript 2024 language specification, which means that it’s officially a standard now. This blog post explains what’s new.
